page.title: 17Our School
page.content: {Twyning school}is in the centre of the village, opposite the{Green.}The school has{101}children aged 4 to 11. There are{4}classes and{5}teachers, one of whom only works in the morning. She gives extra help with reading for some children, and teaches{Class 4 while the head teacher is working in the office. The youngest children are in{Class 1}and the oldest in{Class 4. Three of the classes are in the main school building which was built in{1907,}but{Class 3}has a{terrapin classroom up on our field, where the teachers have an{office}and{staffroom. At dinnertime we are looked after by two{dinner ladies,}and{Mrs Booth cooks dinner for those who do not go home to dinner or have sandwiches. Most of us are able to walk to school, but some live too far away, at {Church End, Hill End}and{Ripple.
